values: Just reflecting; things are a lot altered than they were last year.  I am in such a different place, and I feel contrastingly different than I felt a year ago.  It amazes me that my life can change so much in just one year.

I think my facination with garbage men began when I saw a "Picture Picture" production on Mr. Roger's Neighborhood.  You know how you'd look at the painting on the wall and it would become a TV.  Anyway, this really left an impression on me.  
Every Wednesday morning in the summer I would wake up to the sounds of screeching brakes followed by a roaring acceleration drawing nearer and nearer by the minute.  Then my brother and I would race outside and wave until there wasn't a visible trace left of the truck or last week's garbage.  
Now when it's approach wakes me up, I think what an awful sound that mass of metal and stink makes.  I've decided that these men and their trucks of revulsion are in fact mystical.  Because I've never run across evidence of "garbage men" ever existing. A person has yet come forward and put to rest the myth of the garbage man.  
Until then, to all the garbage men, I still wave to you as you rumble off into the morning fog.
Today I discovered that if there is a tight lump in your throat, whisky can loosen it.

ok.  So selfish people suck, and I'm going to try everyday of my life to not be one.  That is what I learned from my heart demolition.  enlightenment you may not desire, but enlightenment is what you are going to get.  

I understand honesty, even brutal honesty.  I am even agreeable to the nature of the honest words.  I do not, however, understand the portrayal of an act so cloaked in selfishness that it is almost unrecognizable to the one committing the act.  It goes beyond caring for or loving another.  It's a matter of basic morality, humanity, empathy, and compassion.  i'm thankful that I now recognize a lack of these traits, for what a huge mistake was in store.  It is so unfortunate that these acts happen.  We who are truly naive and trusting, those who represent love and give it so freely to those we feel deserving, we are broke, taken advantage of, and deprived of our last innocent breath because we gave it away to someone whom we thought needed it more than we did.  

I became afraid the other day after reading a chapter of Revelations.  Would I be deserving if the seventh angel poured the contents of his bowl onto us tomorrow?  or would I be left behind?  I know that I would be taken.  But what of those who are clothed in their selfishness, no matter how invisible the garments are to them?  those whose acts on others are devoid of the afore mentioned characteristics, and treat others how they were once treated fully knowledgeable of the pain it creates.  No, I don't think they would be saved.  Not until they fully understand the impact of their actions and are truly remorseful.  I am so glad that I am not one of those people.  And I'm so glad that I'm not dating one anymore.

just discovered.  beautiful.   

why do you think i can't sleep?

life is changing.  and it didn't ask my permission.  that pisses me off.  however, I understand the necessity, and that's why i'm ok.  :c) recognition that i possess some of the best qualities one can have;  learning to own that= my goal.





cover my eyes 
so i cannot see
cover my mind 
so i cannot feel
shield me
protect me
love me

bitter internal battles have left us so alone
utter what you really assumed
it's no worse than what we've long since known

Attempts set out with only our best intentions
patience is a virtue you've never owned
grapple and drop our truly treasured possessions

dutifully we accept our fate when realized
safely submerged you're gratefully donned
our quivering pulse, unable to be stabilized

Despite the fact that I'm working 60 hrs this week in addition to classes, and experiencing a bunch of other stress inducers, my spirts are high.  The relationship that I have come to depend on and enjoy the most is progressing into one that I've always hoped for.  I am optimistic that all my hard work will pay off in the end.

I keep feeling like today is someone's birthday... If today is your birthday, I did remember and HAPPY BIRTHDAY.

I need to go shopping for birthday gifts.  But it's so cold and yucky out.  i just want to curl up in bed and read.

Lead me along your tightrope.
A blindfold covers my eyes.
Faithfully I'll follow 
to where I thought you were taking me.
Though without your hand, in this place 
I am lost.

You've never wanted this,
with certainty your knife gleams.
I never saw you cut the rope.
I never saw your look of relief.

For some reason today feels like the worst day of my life.  This is ridiculous because I'm positive I've had worse days.  
my heart feels broken, and I feel like i'm talking walls.  yet again silenced by others' selfishness.  Here I thought i was the most lazy person, yet I, above mostly everyone i've met, am willing to work the hardest.  I can't spell it out more clearly. 
I always thought the person who would understand me the most, aside from God, would be someone who has felt what I felt/feel.  I am finding this to be far from true.  No one wants to be reminded of life's problems even though every single person is immersed in them.  So sorry to bring a sense of reality to everyone's lives.  If we can't get past the sucky things in life than what else is there?
I'm going through one of those phases where LJ is annoying me.  You long-time LJers know what I'm talking about, right?  alright, I'm out for a while.
I'm sitting here with this feeling that my armpits smell really bad right now.  but upon further investigation, to my astonishment, they actually smell good.  that is all.

I've concluded that Oldies 97.5 is really a conspiracy of the Beach Boys.  I honestly heard at least three of their songs an hour at work the other day.  All I could do was wipe away the blood from my bleeding ears.

I had a strenuous rollerblading workout yesterday.  It was nice though, and I needed it.  The best part was a pit-stop at Melting Moments.  Mint Oreo reminded me how good life is.

a cluster headache is one that centers around one or both eyes.  Medically speaking, it is classified as easily becoming more painful than migraines, causes sensitivity to light and sound and nausea/vomiting.  I get these usually once a week but never so intense as today.  Sitting in writing class my left temple began pulsating a sharp pain that continued completely around my left eye.  I couldn't open my eye because the light hurt so badly, so I sat there rubbing my eyebrow with my closed eye tearing.  I was so uncomfortable despite 200 mg of advil that i couldn't think straight.  I had to stay in class though since he was going over the assigned essay due next week.  All I could envision was that dwarf from lord of the rings crashing a large wooden mallet onto a large wooden spike that was positioned over my temple.  i left about a half hour early when he announced it was time to get into groups which takes much much patience from me.  (patience has a way of escaping me in times of blinding pain.)

also, when experiencing a headache of this magnitude, i decided that the girl walking behind me in flip flops had two choices  (1.) pick her freaking feet up when she walked! or (2.) watch me rip them off her feet and chuck them onto the roof of GVT.  

possibly alcohol could fix this problem in the future, as a weekend of nightly pass outs seemingly corrected my chronic back pain. 

for now, my headache has receded and all is well in daynaworld.  :c)  

vegas minus seventeen days.

6/2/05
What am I supposed to think 
I never can decide.
If I'm not careful 
I just might sink.
I've no choice
but to hide.
Elusive, cold and gritty
It's how I have to be.
So guarded and sure
I can't slip now
and let her open
without the key.

Writing class was really inspirational today.  Also, I actually LIKED math class.  frightening.  My math teacher tells the class to "Plug and Chug" while solving equations.  I think that sounds like a fun drinking game.  
I've been neglecting friends lately.  I apologize, but I knew once school got swinging and hours increased at my second job that my social life would be drastically cut.  I will have some time next week, so you all should call me.  
for now, I've been in once place for too long and my planner tells me that I have plans. :c)

a beard and very weird, my writing teacher has bestilled my heart.  actually, he made it beat way too rapidly when it was my turn to talk.  From mind, right down to his shoes, hottness was radiating.
my math teacher is very cool as well.  this was the first time that I thought "this is going to be a great semester" on the first day.  

um.  my liscense is suspended.  (?) 

I'm sorry, world, I feel too good to let you crash down on me right now.  maybe later?

How naive of Robert Oppenheimer to think that by inventing the atomic bomb and catapulting the world into the inevitability of nuclear war all nations would be united and peaceful.  um...right...  His point being that after attaining the knowledge and metals necessary to create nuclear warheads, nations would then be brought together by the intense fear of it's power.  I guess back in 1945 there wasn't a lot of terrorism and no one thought North Korea would become power hungry idiots (withdrawing from the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty and running a secret nuclear program) or that the Soviets would break apart causing poor record keeping and broken security allowing secrets to leak around the world (and were too skeptical from Cold War hostility to allow the US to help contain and clean up in the early nineties).

I think dying in a 100 megaton hydrogen bomb blast would be one of the worst ways to die.   If you want, you can join me in my fallout shelter.  I'm bugging out!

ok, apparently inserting links to live journal is way beyond my capacity of understanding. so this: http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,76888,00.html  goes where the word hydrogen is. and this: http://sc-ems.com/emergencyplan.htm is bugging out.

 

I would just like to take this space to express my anger.  Screw you, Bush, for screwing me over individually by personally raising the gas prices!  I'm now going home to ramble incoherently to my half deaf wife who "loses" her hearing aid the second I pull in the driveway.  Then I'm going to yell at the dog for sitting his poop-encrusted boil-ridden ass in my chair.

alright, someone left me a surprise on my porch.  a little Good Luck Bear key chain, chewy sweet tarts, and a flower.  Also was a card with a sweet message addressed to me.  Can it be, an admirer in my midst?  One who knows my simplistic amusements?  how cute!  
well, whoever you are, can I have more sweet tarts because Whembley ate them?  haha  actually, this sounds like something my girl KD would do.

I need to go rollerblading.  my butt needs an ass kicking.  also, the fading discolorations on my body indicate that it's time to acquire more oddly placed bruises. ew  

5/20/03
black is too endless
white will deceive
when the promises allude
to a fill
emptiness solidifies
please just 
fade to me


When I have kids, I am never going to ask my mom for advice when one of them is sick.  I called her last week when one of the cats was puking everywhere because I wondered if I should take him to the vet or not.  "OH MY GOD, take him to the VET!! He's been POISONED!!"  she yelled, to which I envision the cat climbing under the sink and drinking chemicals from the bottles which have the YUCK stickers on them.  Well, whatever he got into must not have been too poisonous because he's still alive.  Thanks, Mom, for passing on your insatiable taste for drama.  cheers

! what an awesome weekend.  Some unexpected randomness including past flames trying to reignite.  All of last week's drama was washed away, and I don't even feel it's hangover.  



"I always thought Blue Moon ice cream tastes like what blue cream cheese would taste like if it were an ice cream."- BJ

we're planning a road trip.  a final summer whoohaa.  additional attendance equals higher levels of merriment.  details will emerge when I learn them.  :c)
ive never had a more serious reality check.

ughhh.  I thought I was sick yesterday!  Today's development of a cough has blessed me with a continuous burning in my chest.  I've decided that I'm dying.  comforting?  who knows.  I really want a cigarette.

a little praise-worthy news, my budget worked!!!  It was so exciting to actually have a cushion again and no negative signs on my bank statement.  This has convinced me that I can achieve anything I set my mind to.  


I've been an ass lately.  I've been so dramatic lately.  (Granted I've been sick as hell, drunk, menstruating, sleep deprived, nutrients-lacking, and so stressed that I developed an eye tick. Not excuses, I know, but even the most perfect of us need a break once in a while!) This drama emergence is confusing to me because I'm usually not ruffled by the things that have done so.  
   
I'm afraid of mediocrity.  I'm afraid of never attaining what I desire.  The last couple days have proven that drama is not the way to deal with fear.  Drama alienates.  Drama annoys.  Drama is such a worthless form of communication.  Drama instills a feeling of clawing for solid ground, only to erode away what is existing. I wish it were not so hard to identify while immersed.  Just when I think emotions are in check, a different fuel blows on the coals.  Trials and tribulations, my dear.  Tomorrow is always there to give one the chance to start new and self improve.  that's what I've set my mind to for tomorrow.


as for tonight, a friend is bringing over some homemade Thai broth (yum!)and some cough syrup (yuck).  I think they're bringing some movies too.  I need a nice evening to rest-up and de-stress myself.  I think a bubble bath might be in the works as well.

so my first of today's two dates was canceled. (haha apparently hanging out with Todd is a date) :c( I was disappointed because I really really wanted to ride on a motorcycle and on a boat too.  But another time will come.  I needed to run errands anyway.  

I went to go buy rollerblades, but the place was closed because the guys went on a "mini vacation."  I'm going to start rollerblading a) to get my hips/butt/thighs sexified and b) so I can eat whenever/whatever I want without worrying about getting fat.  it's probably good for my heart too.  yay

um the photo shoot pictures are up. However, with sobriety comes a sense of logic and/or tactfulness...yea, I don't really think I want these pictures available to everyone in the world to see.  So I think I'll just show them to who I want to.

until next time

p.s. you know you're getting close to your period when:
you walk down the greeting card aisle at Walfart, pick up the first birthday card for your mom that catches your eye, open and read the simple message, and immediately tear up.

orange ale infused apricot glazed chicken with yams and snap peas...yummy in my tummy!  I smoked a cigar for the first time last night.  very enjoyable, but I had to consciously think not to inhale the whole time.

Last night I partook in a photo shoot.  It was uber fun!  I will post a link on here when they are done being edited.  I think my supermodel sexiness was adequately captured to say the least...haha you'll see. 




thank You for forgiving and loving me.  I will not let You down.

"I desire a simplistic life;  where I love to raise my children and keep my household. Yea, we are suppose to have a career, a second income.  I feel, not only the age old pressure to produce a functional healthy family, but also a life completely separate.  Not that I don't want a career, but why the necessity?"

"Women strove for independence for a reason."  

"But what if their spouse encouraged their individuality;  remained a part of their children's upbringing and wholeheartedly enjoyed their wife, God, and children?"

"Women lost their individuality.  Monotony took over, and they were sacrificed."

"But if they had the support and motivation, they could still make their mark on the world." 

"That's just not how it works.  They [men] all just want mothers."





  perhaps I'm naive,  but tonight made me believe that goodness will/must truly prevail.

I just had the most amazing best weekend that i've had in a loong time.  !  yay for fun summer times.  we did all of my favorite things.  i'll probably elaborate later, I've got like 15 minutes to get ready before I have to leave.  

passez une bonne nuit, tout le monde;  je sais que je ferai :)

OMG!!!!!!!!!!  I was amongst the extrordinary who were blessed to witness the greatness that is JOURNEY this evening!  rock out forever.  <3   

also i got to drive a new mustang.  

thank you.

please, God, I want a pair of red leather pants.

Someone said the word 'soon' to me tonight. I thought of what I had once written.

I feel so
Isolated
Different
...Alone
Why do I do this
An answer is left unknown
Who will understand
No one, I believe
A careless
Spinning
Cycle
I alone will weave
Some cannot be trusted
Even the best of them
Now they all will realize
Soon
Is near the end

arg.  I woke up at 3:30 am.  I have yet to fall back asleep.  I leave for work in 20 minutes.  All morning I kept tossing and turning, hot and cold.  Then I thought to take my temperature and found I am running a fever of 101.8.  my body is so weird.  

I'm trying to deal with things and have realized that I don't want to do it alone.  I want to ask God for help, but I don't know how.  I asked someone to help me learn how to communicate with Him, but that person doesn't seem to want to help me.  What am I supposed to do now?

scratch his nail along
my hand
I knew that I would die.
He waits in the corner 
for the feeding to begin,
he knows that I won't cry.
From young to old
inside out
I melt facing to him.
He's still not happy,
of this I'm sure.
He knows
he'll never win.

i'm sitting here wondering how i'm still drunk.  then i remember last night.  then i smile.  









still smiling.

A necessary head-clearing has arose.  I must blow away the fog.  So I'm going.  And asking for his guidance.  

Eventually I will return to face the demands.  May I find the strength to be the woman I desire to be.





**Stephie, I will make it up to you for missing your b-day.  My guilt is lessened by the knowlegde that you will surely be shitfaced without me :c) HAPPY BIRTHDAY, LOVEY!**

I got a second job.  I got a second job.  I feel so proud of myself!  I love that feeling.  I wish I could bottle it so that when I'm feeling crappy, I could inject it and feel better.  haha i suppose heroin addicts got that idea long before I did.

I also wish that I could be as sensible and productive in other parts of my life as well. But everyone needs some flaws, right?  

all your life you've been taught something, but you never really understood it.  No one took the time to define it in terms you could grasp.  when you start to learn how you fit into this world, you drop that teaching since it never really meant anything to you anyway.  so you go on, but you're feeling like you're running on fumes and not a gas station in sight.  You see how someone else has turned that pile of confusion that you rejected into a definitive part of their life.  You think, how admirable, and wish that you could have benefited, and then maybe you wouldn't feel so empty.
I'm wondering if Stevie Wonder would know the difference if his friends took him to a high school basketball game instead.

I dreampt last night that I was Jem, and the Holograms were competing in a dance contest.  Of course, the last two teams were the Holograms and the Misfits.  I've never had an animated dream before.  It was sweet, and I could do the splits...both ways.  

I also dreampt that the weird Moriarty's jenga chick was standing behind me with her boobs on my head.  i just sat there very annoyed until whomever i was with said, "Could you please get your boobs off Dayna's head?"  

Another dream I had was awful, but I won't get into that. 

It was fantastical to hear from some of the COB's the other night.  Like chimes in my ears, "DAYNA, IT'S THE BRUUUBAKERS!!!!!!!!"  But now that they have jumped into the technological advancement of mobile telecommunication, I am warmed by the knowledge that a reunion is drawing near.  I heard 'I'm loving angels instead' the other night (at a bar none the less).  It made me miss our concerts and overall just chillin on J's bed.  I think the time has come...

I feel like an asshole.  Drinking makes me feel like an asshole.  actually, my body filtering out the alcohol makes me act like an asshole.  

I don't like being emotional about things that don't matter.  my quest to control myself better has been put to the test as of late.  I'm not happy with the way i react to situations.  This is a very difficult thing to do, and i'm doing it alone.  sans prescription toxic ingestables.  sans professionals.  i should do it sans alcohol.

am i aboard a sinking ship?  

I'm trying so hard to be a better person.  



:c) I am vowing to turn this day into a good one. :c)

I open my eyes and instantly am power-bombed by the daylight's reality.  Violently swimming in my head are an acidic mixture of plaguing questions and silent emotions.  I am stuck.  To move wholeheartedly forward is not allowed because I do not know how.  I desire to experience life outside of the shadow that I clutch.  So I wake up and begin once again to mercifully analyze myself.

Cloning is the answer.  Is there a more perfect way to be immersed in self-analysis?  Oh to be relieved from my cliched transitional angst and evaluate from an external position.  Who?  What caused me to drown in the sun's penetrating rays?  Did these daily ulcer-inducing anxieties result from my fear, abuse, love, neglect, confusion as a child?

I would nurture my clone.  My perfectionism would no longer be a hindrance; only a tool.  She would have everything I longed for and be stripped of the hardships that tore away my innocence.  Will she turn out like me?  Of course not.  The deprivation and obstacles make me who I am.  

How would she feel when she is pulled from her secure unconsciousness to face the unforgiving sun?  She is the biggest insight into myself.  I can only hope to one day wake and feel calmed by what I've learned from her.



I wrote that sampler last year on my first day of writing 121 (which i dropped a few days later). The topic was cloning. I don't even know if it makes sense.

i met Crystal tonight.  she's eight and a half months pregnant.  she smokes a lot of pot, and i saw her pot dealer boyfriend on Crimestoppers a few weeks ago.  I just don't get it.  


i hate mondays.  i hate mondays even more when im hungover.  shit.

I've just finished reading an article about CR (caloric restriction).  Tests are still pending, but researchers are theorizing a 30% addition to our life span beyond the normal maximum.  Those who have become devoted to this extreme lifestyle change have boasted such benefits as lower blood pressure and cholesterol which decrease risks for heart disease (America's leading killer).  Also,  a drop in blood sugar and an increase in insulin sensitivity lower risk of diabetes.  
   How intense is this caloric restriction?  So much so that one's ability to perform aerobic exercise is very limited because energy-saturated calories are reduced to about 1,500 a day.  Exercise is evil anyway.  The two molecules we need to survive, oxygen and glucose, end up poisoning us in the end.  Aerobic exercise, by boosting metabolism, accelerates the aging process.  As one CR advocate put it, "Think of it [exercise] as god offering you two extra years of life, provided that you spend them jogging."

So do i eat or not?  exercise?  I am so confused.  What do you want from me, cruel cruel world?  Honestly, i think that the space swallowed up by this article should have been granted to one promoting self-worth and acceptance.  

wait.  an excuse to be lazy?  I think i've found my niche.

ugh.  a friend/co worker, paula, lent me $20 today.  i didn't even ask her, she offered.  all i needed was $12 so that i wouldn't get any overdraft fees.  i absolutely despise money.  

in lieu of all the bitching, anxiety, and ulcers resulting from money woes, i have a few job interviews tomorrow.  somebody hire me!!  

i feel like i'm slipping into a rut.  i don't like it.  i've been looking forward to summer for so long, and i'm going to be so pissed if it blows ass because of lack of stupid money.  

so here's where my idea of becoming a international jewel thief comes into play... HOTT!

guys, please do not recite your shitty poetry to girls whom you are trying to impress while sitting up at a bar.  no matter how drunk both parties are, your poetry is still shitty.  

this guy was sooooooooooo annoying.  5 seconds in, i knew i wanted out.  i also thought to myself, 'how can a person be so irritating??'  and 'maybe he'll stop breathing mid sentence.'
in this afore mentioned poem, he "walked down a street.  and then fell down a sewer because the lid wasn't on.  brushed himself off, hosed himself down. and continued walking."  he fell down the sewer,brushed and hosed FOUR MORE TIMES, until finally he proceeded down a different street which had the sewer lids on...and "that was god's street."  i thought he was trying to be funny.  this coming from someone who understands and appreciates every individual's art.  but COME ON!!!!!  

i was finally rid of this aggravating presence by telling him to play jimi's foxy lady on the juke box, and when he walked away, i laughed because there wasn't a jukebox.  when he returned with a confused and annoyed look upon his face, a friend of mine had replaced his seat at my request.  

why?

some things I love and can't wait to do once summer arrives...

riding my bike, grilling out, playing catch, taking the dogs to the park, hiking, going on a picnic, walking the dogs, laying in the sun, drinking cold beer on our deck on a clear starry night, camping, listening to the crickets while i go to sleep, opening my windows, smelling summer smells, wearing summer clothes and flip flops, enjoying longer days, participating in summer flings, being slightly scared but pleasured by night-time thunderstorms, driving with the windows down, attending baseball games, eating ripe summer fruit such as strawberries and watermelon, dozing in the hammock, witnessing all the colorful and fragrant flowers, and finally experiencing WARM weather!  


please add to my compilation by commenting which summer activities YOU are anticipating.
